subject: Football
organizations: Catholic High School Football League AAA
lead_paragraph: St. Anthony’s of South Huntington, Long Island, won its seventh consecutive Catholic High School Football League AAA title yesterday, beating Mount St. Michael of the Bronx, 26-20, at Hofstra’s Shuart Stadium. Mount St. Michael also lost in last year’s final.The Rutgers-bound defensive tackle Scott Vallone had nine tackles, two sacks and a fumble recovery. He also made a potential game-saving tackle, taking down quarterback Jayson Holt short of a first down at the St. Anthony’s 15 with 59 seconds remaining. William Ruggiero scored two rushing touchdowns for St. Anthony’s (10-1).
